item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

summary.text:
Supports the designation of National Drive-in Movie Night (June 6, 2013).

Recognizes the historical significance of the 80th anniversary of the first exhibition of a film at a drive-in movie theatre.

Recognizes the drive-in theatre as a uniquely U.S. form of family recreation and entertainment.

bill.title: Expressing support for the designation of the night of June 6, 2013, as "National Drive-in Movie Night" to recognize the 80th anniversary of the drive-in movie theatre.

item.title: Expressing support for the designation of the night of June 6, 2013, as "National Drive-in Movie Night" to recognize the 80th anniversary of the drive-in movie theatre.
Expressing support for the designation of the night of June 6, 2013, as "National Drive-in Movie Night" to recognize the 80th anniversary of the drive-in movie theatre.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
